content:
Both personalized items and business books are thoughtful and practical gifts for an MBA graduate.

For a business book, I've got some popular and highly-recommended options that are often appreciated by MBA graduates:

1. **"The Lean Startup" by Eric Ries**: A classic in the startup and entrepreneurship space, this book provides a framework for innovators and entrepreneurs.
2. **"The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People" by Stephen Covey**: A timeless self-help book that offers practical advice on personal and professional development.
3. **"Blue Ocean Strategy" by W. Chan Kim and Renée Mauborgne**: A strategic guide to creating a competitive advantage in the marketplace.
4. **"The Five Dysfunctions of a Team" by Patrick Lencioni**: A must-read for anyone who wants to build a high-performing team.
5. **"Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us" by Daniel H. Pink**: A fascinating book that explores the science of motivation and how to foster a more engaged workforce.
6. **"The Hard Thing About Hard Things" by Ben Horowitz**: A no-nonsense guide to building and running a successful startup or business.
7. **"Crossing the Chasm" by Geoffrey A. Moore**: A marketing and sales classic that helps businesses transition from early adoption to mainstream success.
8. **"The Essays of Warren Buffett: Lessons for Corporate America" edited by Lawrence Cunningham**: A collection of essays from one of the most successful investors in history.
9. **"Playing to Win: How Strategy Really Works" by Roger Martin and A.G. Lafley**: A strategic guide to winning in business, written by a renowned strategy expert and a former P&G CEO.
10. **"Originals: How Non-Conformists Move the World" by Adam Grant**: A thought-provoking book that explores the power of original thinking and innovation.

These books are all highly rated and have been popular among MBA graduates and business professionals. You can't go wrong with any of these options!

Remember to consider your husband's colleague's interests and areas of focus when choosing a book. You could also include a personalized note or inscription to make the gift even more special.
